chinese: [U] the sport or activity of diving without the aid of breathing equipment （不使用呼吸装备的) 自由潜水
examples: e.g. They noticed she was very good at holding her breath and suggested she try [[freediving]].

chinese: [C] (also championships) a competition to find which player, team, etc. is the best in a particular sport 锦标赛；冠军赛
examples: e.g. The sixth game of the World Chess [[Championship]] will be broadcast tonight on Channel 6.

chinese: not studying or looking at sth. carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things 肤浅的；浅薄的；不深入的
examples: e.g. Unfortunately I only had a very [[superficial]] knowledge of music.

chinese: (fml.) in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned 然而；但是；尽管如此；虽然如此
examples: e.g. The region was extremely beautiful. [[Nonetheless]], Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.

chinese: [C] sb. who is watching an event or a game （活动或体育比赛的）观看者，观众
examples: e.g. The final baseball game which was held last Thursday attracted a crowd of over 50,000 [[spectators]].

chinese: [C] sb. who swims or works under water, usu. with special equipment to help them breathe （通常使用特种呼吸辅助装备的）潜水员
examples: e.g. Twenty minutes later, a [[diver]] surfaced and handed a metal box to the elderly gentleman.

chinese: hang or swing loosely, or make sth. do this （使）悬垂；（使）吊着；（使）悬荡
examples: e.g. We stood in the orchard (果园), where the apples were ripe and [[dangled]] just inches above our heads.

chinese: make sb. feel extremely frightened 使恐惧；使十分害怕；使惊吓
examples: e.g. He had imagined that going down in the caves late at night would [[terrify]] her, but instead she felt surprisingly calm.

chinese: not covered by any clothes 裸体的；裸露的
examples: e.g. While she was walking around her house in [[bare]] feet, her mom just didn't seem to notice.

chinese: 1) one of a set of movements in swimming or rowing in which you move your arms or the oar forward and then back （游泳或划船的）一次划水
examples: e.g. She walked into the water and began to swim with strong [[strokes]] to the middle of the lake.；e.g. It is reported that air pollution could also restrict blood flow, causing [[strokes]] and heart attacks.

chinese: 2) a sudden serious illness when a blood vessel in the brain bursts or is blocked, which can cause death or the loss of the ability to move or to speak clearly 脑卒中；中风
examples: e.g. She walked into the water and began to swim with strong [[strokes]] to the middle of the lake.；e.g. It is reported that air pollution could also restrict blood flow, causing [[strokes]] and heart attacks.

chinese: make sth. less tight or firmly fixed; become less tight or firmly fixed （使）放松；变松
examples: e.g. He took a screwdriver (螺丝刀) from his pocket and began to [[loosen]] the screws on the bike.

chinese: [C] sb. who jumps from a plane and falls for as long as they can before opening the parachute （延缓张伞的）特技跳伞运动员
examples: e.g. As a [[skydiver]] falls, he accelerates downward, gaining speed with each second.

chinese: n.[C] a particular position in which sb. stands, sits, etc., esp. in order to be painted, drawn or photographed （为画像、拍照等摆的）姿势
examples: e.g. Please ask the model to stay in that [[pose]] anywhere from 30 seconds to 1 minute.；e.g. Concerns about the danger [[posed]] by fireworks could lead to restrictions on their sale and use.

chinese: vt.create a threat, problem, etc. that has to be dealt with 造成（威胁、问题等）；引起；产生
examples: e.g. Please ask the model to stay in that [[pose]] anywhere from 30 seconds to 1 minute.；e.g. Concerns about the danger [[posed]] by fireworks could lead to restrictions on their sale and use.

chinese: disappear suddenly and / or in a way that you cannot explain （莫名奇妙地）突然消失
examples: e.g. Three boats [[vanished]] without a trace one day and have never been found.

chinese: [U] 声呐（船上或潜艇上利用声波探测水下目标位置的仪器）
[C, U] (fml.) the process of going down 下降；降落
examples: e.g. The night turned cold and heavy rain began to fall during our [[descent]] from the mountain peak.

chinese: vt. (AmE check) mark a test, list of questions, etc. with a tick, in order to show that sth. is correct, to choose sth., etc. 给（试卷、问题等）打钩号
examples: e.g. She is used to [[ticking]] off all of the things that she has done before the end of the day.；e.g. The clock on the wall [[ticked]] away, its sound echoing through the otherwise silent room.

chinese: vi.(also ~ away) if a clock or watch ticks, it makes a short repeated sound （钟表）发出嘀嗒声
examples: e.g. She is used to [[ticking]] off all of the things that she has done before the end of the day.；e.g. The clock on the wall [[ticked]] away, its sound echoing through the otherwise silent room.

chinese: (BrE agonising)1) very unpleasant to experience, esp. because of involving a difficult choice or a long wait （尤因难以抉择或等待过久而）折磨人的
examples: e.g. For two [[agonizing]] minutes the plane dived, shook, and finally landed safely at the airport.；e.g. It was said that a few months ago Mr. Lin died after suffering years of [[agonizing]] pain.

chinese: 2) extremely painful 十分痛苦的
examples: e.g. For two [[agonizing]] minutes the plane dived, shook, and finally landed safely at the airport.；e.g. It was said that a few months ago Mr. Lin died after suffering years of [[agonizing]] pain.

chinese: [C] (also headlamp) （车辆的）前灯；车头灯（的光束）
[C, U] 雾
(fml.) breathe out the air or smoke, etc. in our lungs 呼出，吐出（肺中的空气、烟等）；呼气
examples: e.g. I changed my breathing pattern, inhaling and [[exhaling]] heavily after each set of exercise.

chinese: [C] 水肺；自携式水下呼吸器
[C, usu. pl.] （潜水、游泳时用的）手蹼，脚蹼
help sb. to do sth. 协助；帮助
examples: e.g. Families [[assisted]] teachers with the achievement of educational goals.

chinese: 1) come back up to the surface of the water 重新露出水面
examples: e.g. When the [[divers]] did not [[resurface]] after an hour, three crew members dived down to look for them.；e.g. She [[resurfaced]] briefly about eight years later, to compete with Noriko again for $5 million.

chinese: 2) appear again after being lost or missing （遗失或失踪后）再次出现
examples: e.g. When the [[divers]] did not [[resurface]] after an hour, three crew members dived down to look for them.；e.g. She [[resurfaced]] briefly about eight years later, to compete with Noriko again for $5 million.

chinese: (only before noun) relating to the heart 心脏的
examples: e.g. It is generally believed that patients with [[cardiac]] problems should avoid foods that are high in salt.

chinese: 心脏停搏；心搏停止
(only before noun) below the surface of an area of water, or able to be used there 水下的；水下（使）用的
examples: e.g. Each guide also includes full-color [[underwater]] photographs illustrating the marine life you could expect to see.

chinese: 1) if you look at sb. / sth. keenly or watch them keenly, you look closely at them and notice everything about them （观察）敏锐地
examples: e.g. I looked at him [[keenly]]; he did not blink or even seem embarrassed by what he had just said.；e.g. Scientists are [[keenly]] interested in learning which substances make fruits and vegetables so healthful.

chinese: 2) very strongly 强烈地
examples: e.g. I looked at him [[keenly]]; he did not blink or even seem embarrassed by what he had just said.；e.g. Scientists are [[keenly]] interested in learning which substances make fruits and vegetables so healthful.

chinese: (fml.) cover or wrap sb. / sth. up completely 包住；覆盖
examples: e.g. The mist and rain [[enveloped]] the forest and we could only see the nearest trees.

chinese: [C, usu. sing.] a large area of land that has never been developed or farmed 未开发的地区；荒野；荒凉之处
examples: e.g. As we could see from the film, this place used to be a vast [[wilderness]] of mountains, lakes, and forests.

chinese: 1) the limit of what is known about sth. 未完全开拓的领域；新领域
examples: e.g. The study of the brain is often described by scientists as the next intellectual [[frontier]].；e.g. Many of the cars crossing the [[frontier]] were stopped and searched for illegal goods.

chinese: 2) (esp. BrE) the border of a country 国界；边境
examples: e.g. The study of the brain is often described by scientists as the next intellectual [[frontier]].；e.g. Many of the cars crossing the [[frontier]] were stopped and searched for illegal goods.

chinese: [C] a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement （因违反法律、规则或合约而受到的）惩罚，处罚
examples: e.g. The contract includes heavy [[penalties]] for those people who fail to complete the work on time.

chinese: (only before noun) relating to the sea and the creatures that live there 海洋的；海洋生物的
examples: e.g. We are all quite familiar with news items concerning [[marine]] pollution due to oil spills.

chinese: [C] a very small amount of sth. 一点；少量
examples: e.g. Employees' salaries are just a [[fraction]] of the total cost of the project.

chinese: 1) the act of traveling through a place in order to find out about it or look for sth. in it 勘探；勘查；探索
examples: e.g. You can use this hut as a base for [[explorations]] into the mountains and forests around.；e.g. This chapter begins with a detailed [[exploration]] of the issue of gender discrimination among all age groups.

chinese: 2) an examination of sth. in order to find out about it 探究；研究；探测
examples: e.g. You can use this hut as a base for [[explorations]] into the mountains and forests around.；e.g. This chapter begins with a detailed [[exploration]] of the issue of gender discrimination among all age groups.

chinese: 1) (esp. of people) strange and interesting because you do not know much about them 神秘的；陌生的
examples: e.g. I decided to find out more about my [[mysterious]] new neighbor who lived on the top floor.；e.g. The police are investigating the [[mysterious]] disappearance of a new-born baby at the hospital.

chinese: 2) difficult to understand or explain; strange 神秘的；奇怪的；不易理解的
examples: e.g. I decided to find out more about my [[mysterious]] new neighbor who lived on the top floor.；e.g. The police are investigating the [[mysterious]] disappearance of a new-born baby at the hospital.

chinese: 1) [sing.] (~ of) a small number of people or things 少数人或物
examples: e.g. The new book is by a man who's already written a [[handful]] of best-sellers, most of them about space exploration.；e.g. The boy picked up a [[handful]] of stones and started throwing them at us, which made us annoyed.

chinese: 2) [C] (~ of) the amount that you can hold in your hand 一把（的量）
examples: e.g. The new book is by a man who's already written a [[handful]] of best-sellers, most of them about space exploration.；e.g. The boy picked up a [[handful]] of stones and started throwing them at us, which made us annoyed.

chinese: [C] 水手；海员
[C] sb. / sth. that is dangerous 危险的人或事物
examples: e.g. Drivers like that are a [[menace]]. They shouldn't be allowed on the road.

chinese: [C] 猿
sometimes but not often 偶尔；偶然；有时
examples: e.g. We no longer keep up a close friendship, though we still visit each other on [[occasion]].

chinese: according to the conditions that sb. wants 按照···的条件；根据···的主张
examples: e.g. Don't just accept this job because it would make your parents happy — you need to act on your own [[terms]] for once.

chinese: 威廉 • 特鲁布里奇（新西兰自由潜水运动员）
（美国）公共广播公司
